page.title: 15RELIGION IN OUR AREA
page.content: Many of Croydon's churches were built in the Victorian era. In the last ten years some of the largest churches have fallen into disrepair, and because of small congregations, they have been closed. A few churches have opened their doors to welcome other religions - one church has a regular Sikh meeting. The Established Church may have declined, but other religions and beliefs have developed. Sutton has a wide variety of churches, both old and new. St.Mary's Parish Church,Beddington dates back to the Carew family of the 16th century; All Saints,Carshalton has an equally long history while by contrast, the Baptist Free at Carshalton Beeches is relatively modern.Although the respect- ive denominations are closely defined within Sutton, there is a considerable amount of ecumenical activity.
